lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Bobby.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Bobby.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
// Update the title above to match the actual product name
// Describe the action and its outcome.

* Main class for the Bobby task manager application.
* Handles initialization, command loop, and program entry point.
* Constructs a Bobby instance, loading tasks from the specified file path.
* If loading fails, initializes with an empty task list.
* @param filePath Path to the file storing tasks.
* Runs the main command loop, reading and executing user commands until exit.
* Entry point for the Bobby application.
* Custom exception class for Bobby application errors.
* Constructs a BobbyException with the specified error message.
* Represents a task with a deadline, storing the due date and description.
private static final DateTimeFormatter INPUT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d/M/yyyy HHmm");
private static final DateTimeFormatter OUTPUT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy, h:mma");
* Constructs a Deadline task with the given description and deadline string.
* @param description Description of the deadline task.
* @param by Deadline date as a string in d/M/yyyy HHmm format.
* Constructs a Deadline task with the given description and deadline date.
* @param description Description of the deadline task.
* @param by Deadline date as a LocalDateTime.
* Returns the deadline date of this task.
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task for display.
* @return String representation of the deadline task.
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task for saving to file.
* @return Save format string for the deadline task.
* Represents an event task with a start and end time.
private static final DateTimeFormatter INPUT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d/M/yyyy HHmm");
private static final DateTimeFormatter OUTPUT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy, h:mma");
* Constructs an Event task with the given description and string dates.
* Throws BobbyException if the date format is invalid.
* @param description Description of the event task.
* @param from Start date as a string in d/M/yyyy HHmm format.
* @param to End date as a string in d/M/yyyy HHmm format.
* @throws BobbyException If the date format is invalid.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) throws BobbyException {
throw new BobbyException("Whatdatmean invalid date format fam. Use d/M/yyyy HHmm like 2/12/2019 1800...");
* Constructs an Event task with the given description and LocalDateTime dates.
* @param description Description of the event task.
* @param from Start date as a LocalDateTime.
* @param to End date as a LocalDateTime.
public Event(String description, LocalDateTime from, LocalDateTime to) {

* @return The start date as a LocalDateTime.
* Returns the end date of the event.
* @return The end date as a LocalDateTime.
* Returns a string representation of the event task for display.
* @return String representation of the event task.
* Returns a string representation of the event task for saving to file.
* @return Save format string for the event task.
return String.format("E | %d | %s | %s | %s", isDone ? 1 : 0, description, from.format(INPUT_FORMAT), to.format(INPUT_FORMAT));

* Handles saving and loading tasks to and from a file for persistence.

* Creates parent directories if they do not exist.
* @param tasks List of tasks to save.
* @throws IOException If an I/O error occurs during saving.

* Returns an empty list if the file does not exist or lines are malformed.

* Abstract base class representing a task in the Bobby application.
* Stores description and completion status, and provides common operations.
* Constructs a new Task with the given description.
* Returns whether this task is marked as done.
* @return true if the task is done, false otherwise.
* Returns the description of this task.
* Returns a string representation of the task for display.
* Returns a string representation of the task for saving to file.
* @return Save format string for the task.
* Manages a list of Task objects, providing operations to add, delete, retrieve, and search tasks.
* Constructs a TaskList with the given list of tasks.
* Adds a task to the list.
* Deletes the task at the specified index.
* @param index Index of the task to delete.
* Retrieves the task at the specified index.
* @param index Index of the task to retrieve.
* @return The Task at the given index.
* Returns the number of tasks in the list.
* Returns the list of all tasks.
* Finds tasks whose descriptions contain the given keyword.
* Represents a todo task with a description.
* Constructs a ToDo task with the given description.
* @param description Description of the todo task.
* Returns a string representation of the todo task for display.
* @return String representation of the todo task.
* Returns a string representation of the todo task for saving to file.
* @return Save format string for the todo task.
* Handles user interaction by displaying messages and reading input from the console.
private final Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
* Displays the welcome message to the user.
System.out.println("hi im Bobby\nWhat can I do for you today?");
* Displays an error message to the user.
* @param msg The error message to display.
* Displays a message indicating a task has been marked as done.
* @param task The task that was marked as done.
* Displays a message indicating a task has been added.
* @param task The task that was added.
* @param size The new size of the task list.
public void showTaskAdded(Task task, int size) {
System.out.println("You now have " + size + " tasks in the list.");
* Displays a message indicating a task has been deleted.
* @param task The task that was deleted.
* @param size The new size of the task list.
public void showTaskDeleted(Task task, int size) {
System.out.println("You now have " + size + " tasks in the list.");

* @param tasks The list of matching tasks to display.
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");

* Abstract base class for all commands in the Bobby application.
* Provides the interface for executing commands and checking for exit.
* Executes the command using the provided task list, UI, and storage.
* @param tasks The current list of tasks.
* @param ui The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage handler for saving/loading tasks.
* @throws BobbyException If an error occurs during command execution.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws BobbyException;
* Returns whether this command should exit the application.
* @return true if the command is an exit command, false otherwise.
* Command to delete a specific task from the task list.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand for the specified task index.
* @param taskIndex Index of the task to delete.
* Executes the delete command, removing the specified task and saving changes.
* @param tasks The current list of tasks.
* @param ui The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage handler for saving tasks.
* @throws BobbyException If the task index is invalid.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws BobbyException {
throw new BobbyException("Whatdatmean thats not a task number fam choose a number from 1 to " + tasks.size());
* Command to mark a specific task as done.
* Constructs a DoneCommand for the specified task index.
* @param taskIndex Index of the task to mark as done.
* Executes the done command, marking the specified task as done and saving changes.
* @param tasks The current list of tasks.
* @param ui The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage handler for saving tasks.
* @throws BobbyException If the task index is invalid.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws BobbyException {
throw new BobbyException("Whatdatmean thats not a task number fam choose a number from 1 to " + tasks.size());
* Command to exit the Bobby application.
* Executes the exit command, displaying a farewell message.
* @param tasks The current list of tasks.
* @param ui The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage handler (not used in this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Returns true to indicate that this command will exit the application.
* @return true, since this is the exit command.
* Command to find and display tasks matching a keyword.
* Constructs a FindCommand with the specified search keyword.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for in task descriptions.
* Executes the find command, displaying tasks that match the keyword.
* @param tasks The current list of tasks.
* @param ui The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage handler (not used in this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

* Bobby is a simple chatbot that echoes user input until the user types "bye".
